intro: Adinandra bracteata, commonly known as the African rosewood, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, red or orange berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
